Title: Subcortical afferents to the hippocampal formation in the monkey
Abstract: The distribution of neurons in the basal telencephalon, the diencephalon, and the brainstem that project to the hippocampal formation has been analyzed in mature cynomolgus monkeys (Macaca fascicularis) by the injection of horseradish peroxidase into different rostro-caudal levels of the hippocampal formation. After injections which involve Ammon's horn, the dentate gyrus, and the subicular complex, retrogradely labeled neurons are found in the following regions: in the amygdala (specifically in the anterior amygdaloid area, the basolateral nucleus, and the periamygdaloid cortex); in the medial septal nucleus and the nucleus of the diagonal band; in the ventral part of the claustrum; in the substantia innominata and the basal nucleus of Meynert; in the rostral thalamus (specifically in the anterior nuclear complex, the laterodorsal nucleus, the paraventricular and parataenial nuclei, the nucleus reuniens, and the nucleus centralis medialis); in the lateral preoptic and lateral hypothalamic areas, and especially in the supramammillary and retromammillary regions; in the ventral tegmental area, the tegmental reticular fields, the raphe nuclei (specifically in nucleus centralis superior and the dorsal raphe nucleus), in the nucleus reticularis tegmenti pontis, the central gray, the dorsal tegmental nucleus, and in the locus coeruleus.

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Citation: "In the term hippocampal formation we include the hippocampus proper (or Ammon's horn), the dentate gyrus (or area dentata), and the various cortical fields that comprise the subicular complex (i.e., the parasubiculum, presubiculum, and subiculum) and the medial and lateral entorhinal areas." (p. 573)
@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Comments: It is not stated from which parcellation scheme the description of  the hippocampal formation has been adopted.For the amygdaloid complex it is also not clear from which parcellation scheme it has been adopted.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "... the labeled cells in the nucleus centralis medialis were confined to the side of the injection, but involved both the pars latocellularis and the pars densocellularis, as defined by Olszewski ('52)."
@InterMapRelations.Comments: AC80 delineates the Cdc and Clc according to O52 (see citation above), thus it is likely that the parcellation of the remaining thalamus is based on O52 as well.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "... the labeled cells in the nucleus centralis medialis were confined to the side of the injection, but involved both the pars latocellularis and the pars densocellularis, as defined by Olszewski ('52)."

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "... the labeled cells in the nucleus centralis medialis were confined to the side of the injection, but involved both the pars latocellularis and the pars densocellularis, as defined by Olszewski ('52)."

It is not mentioned from which parcellation scheme this amygdaloid nucleus has been adopted. It can only assumed that it has approximately the same location as the corresponding amygdaloid nucleus showed by AP84.
A hint is that D.G. Amaral has been the author of both papers and that the same abbreviation has been used.

@Injections.Citation:
"In experiment DMH-3, the injection was small (50 nl) and aimed at the middle of the rostro-caudal extent of the hippocampus. At its greatest extent, it labeled the area dentata, all fields of Ammon's horn and the subiculum and presubiculum, but not to the  parasubiculum nor the entorhinal cortex. In this case, there was very little leakage along the needle track, but a few cells in the lateral geniculate nucleus appeared to have taken up the HRP." (p. 575)
"These drawings of coronal sections through the hippocampal formation show the location of the HRP injections at their maximum cross-sectional extent (stippled) in each of the four experiments in this study. The injections in experiments DMH-5 and DMH-4 were into the rostal (or temporal) pole of the hippocampal formation, that in DMH-3 was also close to the middle of its rostro-caudal extent, while that in DMH-7 was into its caudal (or septal) pole." (p. 576, description of figure 1)
@Injections.Comments: In all four cases the white matter is involved by the injection.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation:
"The origin of subcortical projections to the hippocampal formation

In the two cases in which the subicula complex had been involved by the injection, DMH-3 and DMH-7, a large number of retrogradely labeled neurons was seen in the ipsilateral amygdala(Fig. 2). Most of the cells were located in the ventromedial part of the basolateral nucleus, but some were also seen in the anterior amygdaloid area and others were scattered throughout the periamygdaloid cortex. At rostral levels, there were also a few labelled cells in the region between the claustrum and the amygdaloid complex in the area correspnding topographically to the endopiriform nucleus of the cat (Kettek and Price, '77). In experiment DMH-4, in which there was little involvement  of the subicular complex, there were relatively few cells labeled in the amygdala; those that were labeled were confined to the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex.
The finding of a projection from the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex to the subicular region confirms, for the monkey, the earlier observations of Krettek and Price ('77) in rats and cats. These authors reported that after injections of 3H-amino acids into the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex, label was transported anterogradely to the ventral part of the subiculum where it appeared to terminate in the deeper part of the plexiform layer. In their autoradiographs, radioactivity was also seen over the presubiculum, but the authors were inclined to attribute this to the presence of label in fibers that were passing    en route to the subiculum itself. In none of their experiments was any other component of the hippocampal formation labeled. After comparable injections limited to the periamygdaloid cortex, their autoradiographs showed the highest grain densities over the outer part of the plexiform layer of the subiculum, in a zone exactly complementary to that in which the fibers from the basolateral nucleus were found to terminate." (p. 577)
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments:
Two sections in figure 2 show the pattern of retrogradely labeled cells in the amygdaloid complex, but it is not clear (i) which case is mentioned or if it is a summary of all four cases or (ii) if both sections, which are shown, are from one case or from two different/ all cases. 
The following citations could not give a sufficient hint: "In the two cases in which the subicular complex had been involved by the injection, DMH-3 and DMH-7, a large number of retrogradely labeled neurons was seen in the ipsilateral amygdala (Fig. 2)." (p. 577)
"Drawings of representative coronal sections through the amygdala to show the distribution of retrogradely labeled cells in the amygdaloid complex and the adjoining structures. In this and the subsequent figure, each dot marks the location of one labeled cell; while their locations are accurately represented, the dots are, or the sake of clarity, drawn disproportionately large. The numerous cells labeled in the entorhinal cortex (EA) have not been plotted in theses drawings." (p. 579, description of figure 2)
We have decided to understand the two drawings of figure 2 as the presentation of both case DMH-3 and DMH-7, where the two sections represent the labeling pattern at different points , where the sections have been cut.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "All three components of the anterior nuclear complex (Anteroventral, anteromedial, and anterodorsal) and the laterodorsal nucleus contained labeled cells (Fig. 6A) in the two cases in which the subicular complex heavily labeled by the injection (DMH-3 and DMH-7)..."

"... in DMH-3 (and only in this case) there was a small, but significant number of labeled cells in the nucleus reuniens on the side conteral to the injection..."
"...in DMH-3, ..., some cells were seen in this region [ the region of the parataenial and paraventricular nuclei] bilaterally..."

@Injections.Citation:
"The injection in DMH-4 also labeled the rostral pole of the hippocampal formation, but in this case the area dentata, both regions of Ammon's horn, and a small portion of the subiculum were labeled. There a substantial amount of spread of label to the surrounding temporal neocortex and, in addition, the cortex and internal capsule along the trajectory of the needle were labeled." (p. 577)
"These drawings of coronal sections through the hippocampal formation show the location of the HRP injections at their maximum cross-sectional extent (stippled) in each of the four experiments in this study. The injections in experiments DMH-5 and DMH-4 were into the rostal (or temporal) pole of the hippocampal formation, that in DMH-3 was also close to the middle of its rostro-caudal extent, while that in DMH-7 was into its caudal (or septal) pole." (p. 576, description of figure 1)
@Injections.Comments: In all four cases the white matter is involved by the injection.

@Injections.Citation:
"The injection in DMH-5 was again small (70 nl) and labeled the rostral pole of the hippocampus. In this case the subicular complex, the entorhinal area, and most of regio superior were not-involved, but the label may have extended into the caudal part of the amygdala. There was little leakage along the electrode track." (p. 577)
"These drawings of coronal sections through the hippocampal formation show the location of the HRP injections at their maximum cross-sectional extent (stippled) in each of the four experiments in this study. The injections in experiments DMH-5 and DMH-4 were into the rostal (or temporal) pole of the hippocampal formation, that in DMH-3 was also close to the middle of its rostro-caudal extent, while that in DMH-7 was into its caudal (or septal) pole." (p. 576, description of figure 1)
@Injections.Comments: In all four cases the white matter is involved by the injection.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "All three components of the anterior nuclear complex ... and the laterodorsal nucleus contained label [in DMH-3 and DMH-7), ...in experiment DMH-5 there were no labeled cells in any of these nuclei..."

"The origin of subcortical projections to the hippocampal formation

In the two cases in which the subicula complex had been involved by the injection, DMH-3 and DMH-7, a large number of retrogradely labeled neurons was seen in the ipsilateral amygdala(Fig. 2). Most of the cells were located in the ventromedial part of the basolateral nucleus, but some were also seen in the anterior amygdaloid area and others were scattered throughout the periamygdaloid cortex. At rostral levels, there were also a few labelled cells in the region between the claustrum and the amygdaloid complex in the area correspnding topographically to the endopiriform nucleus of the cat (Kettek and Price, '77). In experiment DMH-4, in which there was little involvement  of the subicular complex, there were relatively few cells labeled in the amygdala; those that were labeled were confined to the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex.
The finding of a projection from the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex to the subicular region confirms, for the monkey, the earlier observations of Krettek and Price ('77) in rats and cats. These authors reported that after injections of 3H-amino acids into the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex, label was transported anterogradely to the ventral part of the subiculum where it appeared to terminate in the deeper part of the plexiform layer. In their autoradiographs, radioactivity was also seen over the presubiculum, but the authors were inclined to attribute this to the presence of label in fibers that were passing    en route to the subiculum itself. In none of their experiments was any other component of the hippocampal formation labeled. After comparable injections limited to the periamygdaloid cortex, their autoradiographs showed the highest grain densities over the outer part of the plexiform layer of the subiculum, in a zone exactly complementary to that in which the fibers from the basolateral nucleus were found to terminate." (p. 577)

@Injections.Citation: "Experiment DMH-7 had the largest injection of the series (100nl). This covered the caudal portion of the hippocampal formation and involved the whole cross-sectional area of the area dentata, Ammon's horn, and the subicular complex (including the parasubiculum). The entorhinal cortex,which does not extend as far caudally as this, was not involved, but much of the suurounding temporal neocortex was heavily labeled, as were options of the posterior limb of the internal capsule, the lateral geniculate nucleus, and the pulvinar, along the trajectory of the needle track." (p.  577)
@Injections.Comments: In all four cases the white matter is involved by the injection.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation:
"The origin of subcortical projections to the hippocampal formation

In the two cases in which the subicula complex had been involved by the injection, DMH-3 and DMH-7, a large number of retrogradely labeled neurons was seen in the ipsilateral amygdala(Fig. 2). Most of the cells were located in the ventromedial part of the basolateral nucleus, but some were also seen in the anterior amygdaloid area and others were scattered throughout the periamygdaloid cortex. At rostral levels, there were also a few labelled cells in the region between the claustrum and the amygdaloid complex in the area correspnding topographically to the endopiriform nucleus of the cat (Kettek and Price, '77). In experiment DMH-4, in which there was little involvement  of the subicular complex, there were relatively few cells labeled in the amygdala; those that were labeled were confined to the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex.
The finding of a projection from the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex to the subicular region confirms, for the monkey, the earlier observations of Krettek and Price ('77) in rats and cats. These authors reported that after injections of 3H-amino acids into the basolateral nucleus and the periamygdaloid cortex, label was transported anterogradely to the ventral part of the subiculum where it appeared to terminate in the deeper part of the plexiform layer. In their autoradiographs, radioactivity was also seen over the presubiculum, but the authors were inclined to attribute this to the presence of label in fibers that were passing    en route to the subiculum itself. In none of their experiments was any other component of the hippocampal formation labeled. After comparable injections limited to the periamygdaloid cortex, their autoradiographs showed the highest grain densities over the outer part of the plexiform layer of the subiculum, in a zone exactly complementary to that in which the fibers from the basolateral nucleus were found to terminate." (p. 577)
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments:
Two sections in figure 2 show the pattern of retrogradely labeled cells in the amygdaloid complex, but it is not clear (i) which case is mentioned or if it is a summary of all four cases or (ii) if both sections, which are shown, are from one case or from two different/ all cases. 
The following citations could not give a sufficient hint: "In the two cases in which the subicular complex had been involved by the injection, DMH-3 and DMH-7, a large number of retrogradely labeled neurons was seen in the ipsilateral amygdala (Fig. 2)." (p. 577)
"Drawings of representative coronal sections through the amygdala to show the distribution of retrogradely labeled cells in the amygdaloid complex and the adjoining structures. In this and the subsequent figure, each dot marks the location of one labeled cell; while their locations are accurately represented, the dots are, or the sake of clarity, drawn disproportionately large. The numerous cells labeled in the entorhinal cortex (EA) have not been plotted in theses drawings." (p. 579, description of figure 2)
We have decided to understand the two drawings of figure 2 as the presentation of both case DMH-3 and DMH-7, where the two sections represent the labeling pattern at different points , where the sections have been cut.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "All three components of the anterior nuclear complex (Anteroventral, anteromedial, and anterodorsal) and the laterodorsal nucleus contained labeled cells (Fig. 6A) in the two cases in which the subicular complex heavily labeled by the injection (DMH-3 and DMH-7)..."

publication.title: Subcortical afferents to the hippocampal formation in the monkey
publication.abstract: The distribution of neurons in the basal telencephalon, the diencephalon, and the brainstem that project to the hippocampal formation has been analyzed in mature cynomolgus monkeys (Macaca fascicularis) by the injection of horseradish peroxidase into different rostro-caudal levels of the hippocampal formation. After injections which involve Ammon's horn, the dentate gyrus, and the subicular complex, retrogradely labeled neurons are found in the following regions: in the amygdala (specifically in the anterior amygdaloid area, the basolateral nucleus, and the periamygdaloid cortex); in the medial septal nucleus and the nucleus of the diagonal band; in the ventral part of the claustrum; in the substantia innominata and the basal nucleus of Meynert; in the rostral thalamus (specifically in the anterior nuclear complex, the laterodorsal nucleus, the paraventricular and parataenial nuclei, the nucleus reuniens, and the nucleus centralis medialis); in the lateral preoptic and lateral hypothalamic areas, and especially in the supramammillary and retromammillary regions; in the ventral tegmental area, the tegmental reticular fields, the raphe nuclei (specifically in nucleus centralis superior and the dorsal raphe nucleus), in the nucleus reticularis tegmenti pontis, the central gray, the dorsal tegmental nucleus, and in the locus coeruleus.
